Package clients

Class ControlCentreStub

  • java.lang.Object
    • clients.ControlCentreStub
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlCentreInterface

    public class ControlCentreStub
extends java.lang.Object
implements ControlCentreInterface
    Representation of a place where the Broker coordinates the race and where the Spectators come to relax and be entertained.
    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes

      private lib.communication.ClientCom createConnectionWithServer​()
      Creates a connection to the correspondent server (meaning the ControlCentre).
      void entertainTheGuests​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of a Broker to Entertain the Guests on the ControlCentre.
      void goCheckHorses​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of the last Spectator to go Check the HorseJockey and inform so on the ControlCentre.
      void goWatchTheRace​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of a Spectator to go Watch the Race on the ControlCentre.
      void makeAMove​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of the last HorseJockey to Make a Move and inform so on the ControlCentre.
      void proceedToPaddock​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of the last HorseJockey to Proceed to the Paddock on the ControlCentre.
      void relaxABit​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of a Spectator to go Relax a Bit on the ControlCentre.
      int reportResults​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of a Broker to Report the Results to the Spectators on the ControlCentre.
      void shutdown​()
      Stub entity to shutdown the premises of the ControlCentre.
      void startTheRace​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of a Broker to Start The Race on the ControlCentre.
      void summonHorsesToPaddock​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of a Broker to Summon the HorseJockeys to go to the Paddock from the ControlCentre.
      boolean waitForTheNextRace​()
      Stub entity to represent the will of a Spectator to Wait for the Next Race to start on the ControlCentre.

      • createConnectionWithServer

        private lib.communication.ClientCom createConnectionWithServer​()
                                                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Creates a connection to the correspondent server (meaning the ControlCentre).
        Returns:
        the communication with the server, already defined over a ClientCom object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if a connection could not be established with success.
